title: RIOT HELP!
body:
Hello team Riot!

I've recently seen the 'Master Arcanist Ziggs' splash art and its absolutely stunning.

I was just wondering if you could tell me what is the artist name that design that splash art, and if it was possible to send me a link to that artist's portfolio website.

I was also wondering how long did it take for that artist to finish that splash art.

Thank you.

replies.body:
I want to say that it was probably Alex flores who created that splash art. Hopefully we can get confimation one way or another.

http://alexflores.deviantart.com/gallery/?catpath=/

Yup this one was primarily Alex, but Tesla Effect and Shinijumanjiman bring up an important point - the teams at Riot collaborate and give a lot of feedback, paint-overs, touch ups etc. The end result is always the product of the team as a whole (and is always better for it). Collaboration FTW!

> [{quoted}](name=shinijumanjiman,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=XAtuaN7a,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-04-23T20:13:57.818+0000)
>
> I want to say that it was probably Alex flores who created that splash art. Hopefully we can get confimation one way or another.
> 
> http://alexflores.deviantart.com/gallery/?catpath=/

Its not just him, there are 4 artists that I know on deviantART that do splash art. And as Knockwurst pointed out in his Maokai VU art video, they now do specific parts of each splash art, which means a splash art can have 3-4 artists working on it. This is why art spotlights arent a thing anymore, because getting the recording from each separate artist is hard to do.

This is true, everything at Riot is a collaboration,but just as a champion's kit is the work of the champion design team but usually has one lead on the project, so too is a splash art's composition mainly  the work of one individual.
Sooooooooooo......that just became my desktop background :P
